All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Ball
Abstract class representing the most important aspects of a Ball, leaving only the implementation of making a ball to the class that extends it.
BallFactory
A factory class to instantiate new Ball objects.
BallType
Types of Balls
BasicPainter
This class contains many simple drawing methods used by GameView.
Brick
 
BrickFactory
A factory class to instantiate new Brick objects
BrickImpact
 
BrickType
Types of Bricks
CementBrick
An implementation of the Brick class where the brick has to take a couple hits before it finally breaks, cracking more and more at each hit.
CheckerboardWall
An implementation of class Wall where Brick of 2 types are used together to create a checkerboard effect.
ClayBrick
The most basic implementation of the Brick abstract class.
Controller
Class containing utility fields and methods useful in Controller classes.
Crack
Used in certain Brick types to draw a crack on the brick.
CrackType
Types of cracks
DebugConsoleController
Controller for the Debug Console.
GameController
 
GameModel
Handles Ball-Player-Wall interaction, but leaves as much detail about the levels and their organisation and state to GameModel.wallHandler as possible.
GameView
Every part of this software uses JavaFX, except this class.
HollowWall
An implementation of abstract class Wall.
InfoController
Controller for the info page.
LeaderboardController
Controller for the leaderboard page.
Main
Main class
MainMenuController
Controller for the main menu.
MossBrick
An implementation of the Brick abstract class.
Painter
Interface for Painter classes.
PauseMenuController
Controls the Pause Menu.
Player
Class representing the Player (the sliding bar at the bottom of the game)
RainbowBall
A class that extends Ball.
RubberBall
 
ScoreHandler
Handles dealing with the file system to store/retrieve the list of high scores.
SingleWall
An implementation of the abstract class Wall that produces a wall of bricks of a single type.
SteelBrick
An implementation of the Brick abstract class where a brick is not guaranteed to break when hit, rather, there is a probability SteelBrick.STEEL_PROBABILITY that the steel brick breaks.
Wall
This class handles building walls and interacting with bricks.
WallHandler
Creates new Wall instances and groups them together.
